module.name: program_management
module.keywords: module, systems engineering, program management, project management, risk management, issue management, requirement management

abstract.li: representation of all information necessary to support the management aspects of programs within the domain of systems engineering.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the management of all information necessary to support the management aspects of programs within the domain of systems engineering.
The total set information is composed of several modules that can be verified by exchange of business information among tools. These are the modules:

inscope.li: representation of the information to define and relate information associated with organization;
representation of the information to define and relate information associated with project breakdown;
representation of the information to define and relate information associated with work structure.
risk identification;
relationship between risks;
probability or likelihood of risk;
consequence of risk;
impact from consequence;
source of risk identification;
characterization of risk;
classification of risk;
contingency or risk reduction plan identification, approval, and justification;
approach strategy or risk treatment identification and approval;
residual risk;
risk perception identification and relationships between perceived risks.
association to an issue of any activity that considered the issue or assigned its disposition;
identification of any validation and verification activities applicable to the resolution of the issue;
record of any deferment, annulment, cancelation or reinstatement of an issue;
association to an issue of any change in a product, process or activity with the intent to resolve the issue;
association of verification information to show that a change has resolved the issue, or to any issue consequent on the change where the issue is not resolved.

outscope.li: representation of the information to define and relate information associated with requirement management;
